column4: i accidentally deleted the system tray in gnome anyone know how to go about getting in back?
add it via second-click on the menu bar
Friday
if you don't need it, sure
sure. Set it to at least release the device after an idle period.
what does that entail?
read the man page for esd
sry to keep prying but cant find much useful on ubuntu on about alsa, oss and esd besides what i know...
ok, what are you attempting to do?
well ive noticed you cant run things in oss or alsa without killing esd...any way to get around that?
have them all (3) working as one big happy family :D
personally I use polypaudio, but most of its functionality can be made to work in esd.
have to check with alsa and oss to see if they can work w/ esd?
does pollyaudio work with alsa and oss?...cause im using cedega and it only uses win and oss i believe
it's configured to use alsa's oss emulation, just as esd is configured to do
than why do you have to change xmms to output to esd if you want to play mp3s?..as opposed to alsa or oss
because on a default install, esd runs, so you can't use oss (esd has the device) or alsa (esd has the oss emulation device)
sorry for all the questions. but is there a way to get oss and alsa to play in ubuntu w/ out killing esd?
the default /etc/esound/esd.conf should do that.
just make sure you wait 5 seconds.
hrm k ill go try once more
